verses.plain: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?

tokens.t: put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee

verses.plain: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

tokens.t: bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

verses.plain: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

tokens.t: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

verses.plain: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD’s throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

tokens.t: in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

verses.plain: The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

tokens.t: trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

verses.plain: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.

tokens.t: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest:

verses.plain: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.

tokens.t: loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.

footnotes.text: an horrible…: or, a burning tempest
